15801). <title id="H1F08D7DCC907426194CA9CDF2CF9F0BB" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> I AMERICAN NUCLEAR LEADERSHIP <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E17C3BE4DBB4DF0B752E9922487C4AA" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 101. INTERNATIONAL NUCLEAR EXPORT AND INNOVATION ACTIVITIES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDCBBD5894124B34A58A3D366C0E7188" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Commission coordination <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0446B3B8FFB342BDA48CDCD8695A478F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general The Commission shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7591E88464FA4FB39B4BB486DDF6731D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) coordinate all work of the Commission relating to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1E65E76F7DF4282A25F4D1B916DB89C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) import and export licensing for nuclear reactors and radioactive materials; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD759B7AD1BC7465E81141791961B42B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) international regulatory cooperation and assistance relating to nuclear reactors and radioactive materials, including with countries that are members of— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H476E0FEA5E204E8EA1F22DBCEF79C391" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09150F21E4D94AC0A22C9E1F54A9BA9A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the Nuclear Energy Agency; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1B725951F33B45C59D9A230D00EF3B30" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) support interagency and international coordination with respect to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06BC38FE8DF149D89496F17E10FC2B82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the consideration of international technical standards to establish the licensing and regulatory basis to assist the design, construction, and operation of nuclear reactors and use of radioactive materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08C236A6755945FC8CDF01F144C21E19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) efforts to help build competent nuclear regulatory organizations and legal frameworks in foreign countries that are seeking to develop civil nuclear industries; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H690DE00B22464B57ACCF5BAA8B8861E1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) exchange programs and training provided, in coordination with the Secretary of State, to foreign countries relating to civil nuclear licensing and oversight to improve the regulation of nuclear reactors and radioactive materials, in accordance with paragraph (2). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA695A09DD415427D84AA0678D69E8549" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exchange programs and training With respect to the exchange programs and training described in paragraph (1)(B)(iii), the Commission shall coordinate, as applicable, with— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E6C47B3D88A4CEC9CF50F98C04008FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary of Energy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A11DE0DF184A5C9F7F75E36EBCFA73" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Secretary of State; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H087A1566901A417CBDE7F96374841AE0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the National Laboratories; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD167E6FB4F24DB0B034512A3B734F29" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the private sector; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB09D0B274B54E358518FAE9163AB1D9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) institutions of higher education.

or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09150F21E4D94AC0A22C9E1F54A9BA9A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) the Nuclear Energy Agency; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1B725951F33B45C59D9A230D00EF3B30" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) support interagency and international coordination with respect to— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06BC38FE8DF149D89496F17E10FC2B82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the consideration of international technical standards to establish the licensing and regulatory basis to assist the design, construction, and operation of nuclear reactors and use of radioactive materials; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08C236A6755945FC8CDF01F144C21E19" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) efforts to help build competent nuclear regulatory organizations and legal frameworks in foreign countries that are seeking to develop civil nuclear industries; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H690DE00B22464B57ACCF5BAA8B8861E1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) exchange programs and training provided, in coordination with the Secretary of State, to foreign countries relating to civil nuclear licensing and oversight to improve the regulation of nuclear reactors and radioactive materials, in accordance with paragraph (2). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA695A09DD415427D84AA0678D69E8549" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exchange programs and training With respect to the exchange programs and training described in paragraph (1)(B)(iii), the Commission shall coordinate, as applicable, with— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E6C47B3D88A4CEC9CF50F98C04008FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary of Energy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB3A11DE0DF184A5C9F7F75E36EBCFA73" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Secretary of State; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H087A1566901A417CBDE7F96374841AE0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the National Laboratories; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD167E6FB4F24DB0B034512A3B734F29" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the private sector; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB09D0B274B54E358518FAE9163AB1D9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) institutions of higher education. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF15157EB7F71413683405739C11FD3BC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authority To establish branch The Commission may establish within the Office of International Programs a branch, to be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">International Nuclear Export and Innovation Branch, to carry out the international nuclear export and innovation activities described in subsection (a) as the Commission determines to be appropriate and within the mission of the Commission.

DENIAL OF CERTAIN DOMESTIC LICENSES FOR NATIONAL SECURITY PURPOSES <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H873C9DD807C74C8A900B350FF56085F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Definition of covered fuel In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered fuel means enriched uranium that is fabricated outside the United States into fuel assemblies for commercial nuclear power reactors by an entity that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H902856BDCC9A4DC092DC869E0C180FE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) is owned or controlled by the Government of the Russian Federation or the Government of the People’s Republic of China; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA29E577F2984DE89408D03832285D04" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) is organized under the laws of, or otherwise subject to the jurisdiction of, the Russian Federation or the People’s Republic of China.

context: 2073) and part 70 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), no person subject to the jurisdiction of the Commission may possess or own covered fuel. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48EB91984AFE4BD6B3EDD4514A640543" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) License To possess or own covered fuel <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D35AAD9FDDA406F92789DB6AF97F16F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Consultation required prior to issuance The Commission shall not issue a license to possess or own covered fuel under section 53 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2073) and part 70 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), unless the Commission has first consulted with the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State before issuing the license.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DD94EBC8C6421DB165197B9FD85D6A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Determination <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02E6C50F6A894118997AED8C49AC7165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The determination referred to in subparagraph (A) is a determination that possession or ownership, as applicable, of covered fuel— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22316CBCB5154D0698914E77F351ACF5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) poses a threat to the national security of the United States, including because of an adverse impact on the physical and economic security of the United States; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E655BD9D8234C01A77408FE07717BA2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) does not pose a threat to the national security of the United States. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H396BEBAEA1314116A2384E5B5CD2AB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Joint determination A determination described in clause (i) shall be jointly made by the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DD94EBC8C6421DB165197B9FD85D6A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Determination <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02E6C50F6A894118997AED8C49AC7165" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The determination referred to in subparagraph (A) is a determination that possession or ownership, as applicable, of covered fuel— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22316CBCB5154D0698914E77F351ACF5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) poses a threat to the national security of the United States, including because of an adverse impact on the physical and economic security of the United States; or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E655BD9D8234C01A77408FE07717BA2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) does not pose a threat to the national security of the United States. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H396BEBAEA1314116A2384E5B5CD2AB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Joint determination A determination described in clause (i) shall be jointly made by the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H396BEBAEA1314116A2384E5B5CD2AB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Joint determination A determination described in clause (i) shall be jointly made by the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEFE9A7E982DC4B4EB4C99E9857C614B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) Determination The Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall have a period of 180 days, beginning on the date on which the Commission notifies the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State under subclause (I) of an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, in which to make the determination described in clause (i).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H396BEBAEA1314116A2384E5B5CD2AB07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Joint determination A determination described in clause (i) shall be jointly made by the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEFE9A7E982DC4B4EB4C99E9857C614B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) Determination The Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall have a period of 180 days, beginning on the date on which the Commission notifies the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State under subclause (I) of an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, in which to make the determination described in clause (i).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEFE9A7E982DC4B4EB4C99E9857C614B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) Determination The Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall have a period of 180 days, beginning on the date on which the Commission notifies the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State under subclause (I) of an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, in which to make the determination described in clause (i). <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D4A69C2E884F508D0205CC7A64A35D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) Commission notification On making the determination described in clause (i), the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall immediately notify the Commission.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE747FE61BA044387B219113F100DD10B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Timeline <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC6AC266D5854404863E73659FBA9A76" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) Notice of application Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission receives an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, the Commission shall notify the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State of the application. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEFE9A7E982DC4B4EB4C99E9857C614B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) Determination The Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall have a period of 180 days, beginning on the date on which the Commission notifies the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State under subclause (I) of an application for a license to possess or own covered fuel, in which to make the determination described in clause (i). <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D4A69C2E884F508D0205CC7A64A35D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) Commission notification On making the determination described in clause (i), the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall immediately notify the Commission.

<subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23D4A69C2E884F508D0205CC7A64A35D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (III) Commission notification On making the determination described in clause (i), the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State shall immediately notify the Commission. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19A055F3B2DC4A37B4DF056B950FF586" qb-display-quote="yes"> (IV) Congressional notification Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State notify the Commission under subclause (III), the Commission shall notify the appropriate committees of Congress, the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate, the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate, and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives of the determination. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7FD51D34D2A4F8D9A1CA71FFBDD2E35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (V) Public notice Not later than 15 days after the date on which the Commission notifies Congress under subclause (IV) of a determination made under clause (i), the Commission shall make that determination publicly available.

<subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19A055F3B2DC4A37B4DF056B950FF586" qb-display-quote="yes"> (IV) Congressional notification Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State notify the Commission under subclause (III), the Commission shall notify the appropriate committees of Congress, the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate, the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate, and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives of the determination. <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7FD51D34D2A4F8D9A1CA71FFBDD2E35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (V) Public notice Not later than 15 days after the date on which the Commission notifies Congress under subclause (IV) of a determination made under clause (i), the Commission shall make that determination publicly available. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBC7A2E4E89143C58FC87CA1A96A7878" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Effect of no determination The Commission shall not issue a license if the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State have not made a determination described in subparagraph (B).

<subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7FD51D34D2A4F8D9A1CA71FFBDD2E35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (V) Public notice Not later than 15 days after the date on which the Commission notifies Congress under subclause (IV) of a determination made under clause (i), the Commission shall make that determination publicly available. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBC7A2E4E89143C58FC87CA1A96A7878" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Effect of no determination The Commission shall not issue a license if the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State have not made a determination described in subparagraph (B). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB9F6284E6BC46E8A789743E0CE7F446" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Savings clause Nothing in this section alters any treaty or international agreement in effect on the date of enactment of this Act or that enters into force after the date of enactment of this Act.

<subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7FD51D34D2A4F8D9A1CA71FFBDD2E35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (V) Public notice Not later than 15 days after the date on which the Commission notifies Congress under subclause (IV) of a determination made under clause (i), the Commission shall make that determination publicly available. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBC7A2E4E89143C58FC87CA1A96A7878" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Effect of no determination The Commission shall not issue a license if the Secretary of Energy and the Secretary of State have not made a determination described in subparagraph (B). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBB9F6284E6BC46E8A789743E0CE7F446" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Savings clause Nothing in this section alters any treaty or international agreement in effect on the date of enactment of this Act or that enters into force after the date of enactment of this Act.

EXPORT LICENSE NOTIFICATION <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68785C1F6B1E4CBB8DECFF0A2813E730" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Definition of low-Enriched uranium In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">low-enriched uranium means uranium enriched to less than 20 percent of the uranium-235 isotope. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H430BDE271BC04E13995D8C3461DC2645" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Notification If the Commission, after consultation with the Secretary of State and any other relevant agencies, issues an export license for the transfer of any item described in subsection (d) to a country described in subsection (c), the Commission shall notify the appropriate committees of Congress, the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate, the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate, and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H430BDE271BC04E13995D8C3461DC2645" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Notification If the Commission, after consultation with the Secretary of State and any other relevant agencies, issues an export license for the transfer of any item described in subsection (d) to a country described in subsection (c), the Commission shall notify the appropriate committees of Congress, the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate, the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate, and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD03209ECE24D49C6B6373A5AEF88A253" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Countries described A country referred to in subsection (b) is a country that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H28F99E0704374C5698C945A1E503A84E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) has not concluded and ratified an Additional Protocol to its safeguards agreement with the International Atomic Energy Agency; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E5F8600AFE14E93AA58CBB1F534490E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) has not ratified or acceded to the amendment to the Convention on the Physical Protection of Nuclear Material, adopted at Vienna October 26, 1979, and opened for signature at New York March 3, 1980 (TIAS 11080), described in the information circular of the International Atomic Energy Agency numbered INFCIRC/274/Rev.1/Mod.1 and dated May 9, 2016 (TIAS 16–508). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07D8071B90BC40F3AE1DE93BDDEB1AB2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Items described An item referred to in subsection (b) includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEAF24AE7CA034DFC9B00232EA93F4F70" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) unirradiated nuclear fuel containing special nuclear material (as defined in section 11 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C.

context: <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD03209ECE24D49C6B6373A5AEF88A253" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Countries described A country referred to in subsection (b) is a country that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H28F99E0704374C5698C945A1E503A84E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) has not concluded and ratified an Additional Protocol to its safeguards agreement with the International Atomic Energy Agency; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E5F8600AFE14E93AA58CBB1F534490E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) has not ratified or acceded to the amendment to the Convention on the Physical Protection of Nuclear Material, adopted at Vienna October 26, 1979, and opened for signature at New York March 3, 1980 (TIAS 11080), described in the information circular of the International Atomic Energy Agency numbered INFCIRC/274/Rev.1/Mod.1 and dated May 9, 2016 (TIAS 16–508). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07D8071B90BC40F3AE1DE93BDDEB1AB2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Items described An item referred to in subsection (b) includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEAF24AE7CA034DFC9B00232EA93F4F70" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) unirradiated nuclear fuel containing special nuclear material (as defined in section 11 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2014)), excluding low-enriched uranium; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H610517B6DAF942D1BB582DFAE43305F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a nuclear reactor that uses nuclear fuel described in paragraph (1); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38D42C7FBF674D6090FEB6E0DA3CBE95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) any plant or component listed in Appendix I to part 110 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), that is involved in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61D6693D219F49E9BBD181C0B2F0DC79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the reprocessing of irradiated nuclear reactor fuel elements; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H60263968FEE04D53B8ADAE88D266BF65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the separation of plutonium; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A7E5AA728E94AB59AD4B3D3C7D90F01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the separation of the uranium-233 isotope.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07D8071B90BC40F3AE1DE93BDDEB1AB2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Items described An item referred to in subsection (b) includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEAF24AE7CA034DFC9B00232EA93F4F70" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) unirradiated nuclear fuel containing special nuclear material (as defined in section 11 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2014)), excluding low-enriched uranium; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H610517B6DAF942D1BB582DFAE43305F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a nuclear reactor that uses nuclear fuel described in paragraph (1); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38D42C7FBF674D6090FEB6E0DA3CBE95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) any plant or component listed in Appendix I to part 110 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), that is involved in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H61D6693D219F49E9BBD181C0B2F0DC79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the reprocessing of irradiated nuclear reactor fuel elements; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H60263968FEE04D53B8ADAE88D266BF65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the separation of plutonium; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A7E5AA728E94AB59AD4B3D3C7D90F01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the separation of the uranium-233 isotope. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C30CCD6990E431BA44F9BC32D74D5B6" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 104.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C30CCD6990E431BA44F9BC32D74D5B6" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 104. GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D4C58D261824D798467C62FDD53AFD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the supply chains of the civilian nuclear energy industry. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B8BB1D18704AE9922846E9F96F52C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents The study conducted under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB325439E46C649F397A384CF5F59E9FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) information on the status of the civilian nuclear energy industry, the long-term risks to that industry, and the bases for those risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB6EEF73401C4F689B1479D34D51ED07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) information on how the use of the civilian nuclear energy industry, relative to other types of energy industries, can reduce the emission of criteria pollutants and carbon dioxide; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FD348516FE945B39B81F7D66958BCC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) information on the role the United States civilian nuclear energy industry plays in United States foreign policy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D4C58D261824D798467C62FDD53AFD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the supply chains of the civilian nuclear energy industry. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B8BB1D18704AE9922846E9F96F52C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents The study conducted under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB325439E46C649F397A384CF5F59E9FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) information on the status of the civilian nuclear energy industry, the long-term risks to that industry, and the bases for those risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB6EEF73401C4F689B1479D34D51ED07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) information on how the use of the civilian nuclear energy industry, relative to other types of energy industries, can reduce the emission of criteria pollutants and carbon dioxide; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FD348516FE945B39B81F7D66958BCC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) information on the role the United States civilian nuclear energy industry plays in United States foreign policy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D4C58D261824D798467C62FDD53AFD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the supply chains of the civilian nuclear energy industry. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B8BB1D18704AE9922846E9F96F52C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents The study conducted under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB325439E46C649F397A384CF5F59E9FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) information on the status of the civilian nuclear energy industry, the long-term risks to that industry, and the bases for those risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB6EEF73401C4F689B1479D34D51ED07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) information on how the use of the civilian nuclear energy industry, relative to other types of energy industries, can reduce the emission of criteria pollutants and carbon dioxide; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FD348516FE945B39B81F7D66958BCC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) information on the role the United States civilian nuclear energy industry plays in United States foreign policy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D4C58D261824D798467C62FDD53AFD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the supply chains of the civilian nuclear energy industry. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B8BB1D18704AE9922846E9F96F52C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents The study conducted under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB325439E46C649F397A384CF5F59E9FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) information on the status of the civilian nuclear energy industry, the long-term risks to that industry, and the bases for those risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB6EEF73401C4F689B1479D34D51ED07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) information on how the use of the civilian nuclear energy industry, relative to other types of energy industries, can reduce the emission of criteria pollutants and carbon dioxide; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FD348516FE945B39B81F7D66958BCC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) information on the role the United States civilian nuclear energy industry plays in United States foreign policy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

context: GLOBAL NUCLEAR ENERGY ASSESSMENT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C1F82C5FCDA42158D3F71A7E3C6A6D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Study required Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Commerce, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Commission, shall conduct a study on the global status of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8F7A7FE118649E4B61C7B611282C388" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the civilian nuclear energy industry; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D4C58D261824D798467C62FDD53AFD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the supply chains of the civilian nuclear energy industry. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H21B8BB1D18704AE9922846E9F96F52C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents The study conducted under subsection (a) shall include— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB325439E46C649F397A384CF5F59E9FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) information on the status of the civilian nuclear energy industry, the long-term risks to that industry, and the bases for those risks; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB6EEF73401C4F689B1479D34D51ED07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) information on how the use of the civilian nuclear energy industry, relative to other types of energy industries, can reduce the emission of criteria pollutants and carbon dioxide; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FD348516FE945B39B81F7D66958BCC1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) information on the role the United States civilian nuclear energy industry plays in United States foreign policy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03A08D93382E40ACB05EFD5E215D6D3A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) information on the importance of the United States civilian nuclear energy industry to countries that are allied to the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD5CC6483B6A423E9DD5F30F0487B74A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) information on how the United States may collaborate with those countries in developing, deploying, and investing in nuclear technology; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49DB77693C05403EAFEEA221335ABFB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) information on how foreign countries use nuclear energy when crafting and implementing their own foreign policy, including such use by foreign countries that are strategic competitors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H451D9CEA2D2A48ED82B1ED2AF963CE92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) an evaluation of how nuclear nonproliferation and security efforts and nuclear energy safety are affected by the involvement of the United States in— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A54205819344971BA950531187DFB43" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) international markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF29798A4F6A2425ABAB833B34A063E75" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) setting civilian nuclear energy industry standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3014AF4829C94114A03C68D115470F83" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) an evaluation of how industries in the United States, other than the civilian nuclear energy industry, benefit from the generation of electricity by nuclear power plants; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36530D0F1D4947F3BA2A84E94B261C10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) information on utilities and companies in the United States that are involved in the civilian nuclear energy supply chain, including, with respect to those utilities and companies— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D02AB95916B4655B328167BE3BE9DF3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) financial challenges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDB9E4DD3965D4A5FBD427865758C6635" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) nuclear liability issues; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4816A02FBE5340B39815BDB2DFDA0A6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) foreign strategic competition; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6B934578D104AF891F1AD13CD41FB81" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) risks to continued operation; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD07EB2646244447589AC16AEEBD360DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) recommendations for how the United States may— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H734EE1FF85BF4BF48A5761A52909BD89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) develop a national strategy to increase the role that nuclear energy plays in diplomacy and strategic energy policy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0C4595A2DE549E3BDCCF0BDE17BD317" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) develop a strategy to mitigate foreign competitor’s utilization of their civilian nuclear energy industries in diplomacy; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF007AF087E8B48C28AEC80A2ACE704BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) align the nuclear energy policy of the United States with national security objectives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43CD1E0992EA4ABEA6BBC99CEB73CE15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) modernize regulatory requirements to strengthen the United States civilian nuclear energy supply chain. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6223E20EA8147E4880F8F9C71964210" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report to Congress Not later than 180 days after the study under subsection (a) is completed, the Secretary of Energy shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the study, including a classified annex, if necessary.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF7E7FE4B1897454BAF830527F5E88D67" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Process Update The Secretary of Energy shall review and, as appropriate, update the Department of Energy’s process for determining a country’s generally authorized destination status under part 810 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations, and for listing such country as a generally authorized destination in Appendix A to part 810 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations, taking into consideration and, as appropriate, incorporating factors identified and evaluated under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA08F48CFCB1641BCAA22668CC6E1BC6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Revisions to List Not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act, and at least once every 5 years thereafter, the Secretary of Energy shall, in accordance with any process updated pursuant to this section, review the list in Appendix A to part 810 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations, and amend such list as appropriate. <title id="H902E5C23C3BA41278DBB0A49A9398C8B" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> II DEVELOPING AND DEPLOYING NEW NUCLEAR TECHNOLOGIES <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC6684812CEC476692CF5813E3C46665" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 201.

text: section 103 d. of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954
context: <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FF7432D558E4F7D903C6CF49FCE97DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Excluded activities Section 102(b)(1)(B) of the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act (42 U.S.C. 2215(b)(1)(B)) (as amended by section 101(c)(1)(B)) is amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HFF4BABF393B04E599C9DFC86EB7D4D24" style="OLC"> <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE5DEF04FD5F41739EE04AFFFAF48B00" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) The total costs of mission-indirect program support and agency support that, under paragraph (2)(B), may not be included in the hourly rate charged for fees assessed and collected from advanced nuclear reactor applicants. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8675F46AC0FE4FD59BCB57ADD421C8CC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vi) The total costs of mission-indirect program support and agency support that, under paragraph (2)(C), may not be included in the hourly rate charged for fees assessed and collected from advanced nuclear reactor pre-applicants.
