. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H52B9D3DD505242198A9EF9B3A00955E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Fees for service or thing of value Section 102(b) of the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act (42 U.S.C. 2215(b)) is amended by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H2D5E81A2C6BF4DDDAF8DCAE0E5E517C7" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H586A8503A9A848749499B6272F2C6C58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Fees for service or thing of value <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7E700CEDCF924BBDA22D5328F8914D52" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general In accordance with section 9701 of title 31, United States Code, the Commission shall assess and collect fees from any person who receives a service or thing of value from the Commission to cover the costs to the Commission of providing the service or thing of value.

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H52B9D3DD505242198A9EF9B3A00955E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Fees for service or thing of value Section 102(b) of the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act (42 U.S.C. 2215(b)) is amended by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H2D5E81A2C6BF4DDDAF8DCAE0E5E517C7" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H586A8503A9A848749499B6272F2C6C58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Fees for service or thing of value <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7E700CEDCF924BBDA22D5328F8914D52" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general In accordance with section 9701 of title 31, United States Code, the Commission shall assess and collect fees from any person who receives a service or thing of value from the Commission to cover the costs to the Commission of providing the service or thing of value.

text: section 231 of the Countering America’s Adversaries Through Sanctions Act
context: <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H52B9D3DD505242198A9EF9B3A00955E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Fees for service or thing of value Section 102(b) of the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act (42 U.S.C. 2215(b)) is amended by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H2D5E81A2C6BF4DDDAF8DCAE0E5E517C7" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H586A8503A9A848749499B6272F2C6C58" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Fees for service or thing of value <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7E700CEDCF924BBDA22D5328F8914D52" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general In accordance with section 9701 of title 31, United States Code, the Commission shall assess and collect fees from any person who receives a service or thing of value from the Commission to cover the costs to the Commission of providing the service or thing of value. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEDD47C55EB824A0C9E80171F2438E376" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Advanced nuclear reactor applicants The hourly rate charged for fees assessed and collected from an advanced nuclear reactor applicant under this paragraph relating to the review of a submitted application described in section 3(1) may not exceed the hourly rate for mission-direct program salaries and benefits.

text: Section 313 of division C of the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009
context: 5571) is amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H65E5C8F9A9964EDE90833E355C6EC530" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3248FEBA073647B286284A26EA9C2967" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Prizes for advanced nuclear reactor licensing <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9B97D61F93E54E35BB0C75FD2F3F9244" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Definition of eligible entity In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">eligible entity means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H28EE9173F14549DB9D13055B20CC9395" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a non-Federal entity; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H904774EBFCED4BD086C727D2790E69C1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Tennessee Valley Authority. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H789425F0E01B4F29A06EEB64A357E255" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Prize for advanced nuclear reactor licensing <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D51E78C9BF64CF0A777BD730DDA5118" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Notwithstanding section 169 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2209) and subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary is authorized to make, with respect to each award category described in subparagraph (C), an award in an amount described in subparagraph (B) to the first eligible entity— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8342B2DC6B82408FA00617F643BDBF9E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) to which the Commission issues an operating license for an advanced nuclear reactor under part 50 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), for which an application has not been approved by the Commission as of the date of enactment of this subsection; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7681292E45CD47DE8581D0A0A14A1225" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) for which the Commission makes a finding described in section 52.103(g) of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), with respect to a combined license for an advanced nuclear reactor— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC25CDAFC59D64D4585A057B2D2ED3470" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) that is issued under subpart C of part 52 of that title (or successor regulations); and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4DE1A277132E48089EC1E85AE8EE25ED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) for which an application has not been approved by the Commission as of the date of enactment of this subsection.

text: section 2 of the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982
context: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6023C113C190406D84FBFF02BBE90AA3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Amount of award Subject to paragraph (3), an award under subparagraph (A) shall be in an amount equal to the total amount assessed by the Commission and collected under section 102(b)(2) from the eligible entity receiving the award for costs relating to the issuance of the license described in that subparagraph, including, as applicable, costs relating to the issuance of an associated construction permit described in section 50.23 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), or early site permit (as defined in section 52.1 of that title (or successor regulations)). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6AC849BDBD14E2C9A6078D6FDC6B575" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Award categories An award under subparagraph (A) may be made for— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C84EDD1A71F49F9B98E61BC9FA44A7D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the first advanced nuclear reactor for which the Commission— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDC144D73F237444F9BAC23A9D4F9283F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) issues a license in accordance with clause (i) of subparagraph (A); or <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0EEEC245584643C9AFFBDF6368B0A088" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) makes a finding in accordance with clause (ii) of that subparagraph; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD5C8AB67E1834FD584556B878C1F4978" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) an advanced nuclear reactor that— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H566DE123D6214DA6A2BD16401B819DDC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) uses isotopes derived from spent nuclear fuel (as defined in section 2 of the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 (42 U.S.C. 10101)) or depleted uranium as fuel for the advanced nuclear reactor; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96A36F911D79424DBF16788614A56AA8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is the first advanced nuclear reactor described in subclause (I) for which the Commission— <item display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB93D603D2B0B49FE9C3D53C53692D39D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (aa) issues a license in accordance with clause (i) of subparagraph (A); . <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAB20771A68D4E6DBFE4DAD115014C48" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 203. LICENSING CONSIDERATIONS RELATING TO USE OF NUCLEAR ENERGY FOR NONELECTRIC APPLICATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H27EAA4B4B44E4FE39520B0BBBD25E847" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report addressing any unique licensing issues or requirements relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4CFB18BFFE5C4074B164BFDB52D18F91" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the flexible operation of advanced nuclear reactors, such as ramping power output and switching between electricity generation and nonelectric applications; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BB918A9F3B04973B402D5FDCF61037B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the use of advanced nuclear reactors exclusively for nonelectric applications; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD5C329B78FFD4964BCC138DFB9CF16B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the colocation of nuclear reactors with industrial plants or other facilities.

LICENSING CONSIDERATIONS RELATING TO USE OF NUCLEAR ENERGY FOR NONELECTRIC APPLICATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H27EAA4B4B44E4FE39520B0BBBD25E847" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report addressing any unique licensing issues or requirements relating to— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4CFB18BFFE5C4074B164BFDB52D18F91" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the flexible operation of advanced nuclear reactors, such as ramping power output and switching between electricity generation and nonelectric applications; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BB918A9F3B04973B402D5FDCF61037B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the use of advanced nuclear reactors exclusively for nonelectric applications; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD5C329B78FFD4964BCC138DFB9CF16B0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the colocation of nuclear reactors with industrial plants or other facilities. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB25471E0A9EF45A2B4A3A42EC5406C25" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Stakeholder input In developing the report under subsection (a), the Commission shall seek input from— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2C9571512914CE0ADF46D6B4280AF07" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Secretary of Energy; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67ADDE2C8314433A82A31B4C048E49F5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the nuclear energy industry; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32F36EC2025347C28334247745EA3F3C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) technology developers; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFE3850603294834AFB6584B04EA642C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the industrial, chemical, and medical sectors; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2871C78ACFE43679224F4A369A64779" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) nongovernmental organizations; 2014). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H638C2864616A488391157EC95D8A4C04" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirement Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD03B80918DEA4F46A7BD643360B3A907" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the results of a study, conducted in consultation with Agreement States and the private fusion sector, on risk- and performance-based, design-specific licensing frameworks for mass-manufactured fusion machines, including an evaluation of the design, manufacturing, and operations certification process used by the Federal Aviation Administration for aircraft as a potential model for mass-manufactured fusion machine regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04775FF5E6434B4CA5B26EAD35C9BF1D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the estimated timeline for the Commission to issue consolidated guidance or regulations for licensing mass-manufactured fusion machines, taking into account— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE90A9584FBD0468B981CBC549BFE7A53" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the results of that study; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8E78AE196E6048C5B42A099E35316E41" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the anticipated need for such guidance or regulations. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3C71BC4453D4A8880D382C6C8CEBF7E" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 206.

2014). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H638C2864616A488391157EC95D8A4C04" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirement Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD03B80918DEA4F46A7BD643360B3A907" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the results of a study, conducted in consultation with Agreement States and the private fusion sector, on risk- and performance-based, design-specific licensing frameworks for mass-manufactured fusion machines, including an evaluation of the design, manufacturing, and operations certification process used by the Federal Aviation Administration for aircraft as a potential model for mass-manufactured fusion machine regulations; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04775FF5E6434B4CA5B26EAD35C9BF1D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the estimated timeline for the Commission to issue consolidated guidance or regulations for licensing mass-manufactured fusion machines, taking into account— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE90A9584FBD0468B981CBC549BFE7A53" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the results of that study; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8E78AE196E6048C5B42A099E35316E41" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the anticipated need for such guidance or regulations. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA3C71BC4453D4A8880D382C6C8CEBF7E" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 206.

2014). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC44AEAD1A6E34EE9825B2DCD9FD2736F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Identification of regulatory issues <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA57439B5411049CAAD204E1E01D4E49E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall evaluate the extent to which modification of regulations, guidance, or policy is needed to enable efficient, timely, and predictable licensing reviews for, and to support the oversight of, production facilities or utilization facilities at covered sites. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70F34C4F2AE743228F5B3F252F0C9176" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirement In carrying out paragraph (1), the Commission shall consider how licensing reviews for production facilities or utilization facilities at covered sites may be expedited by considering matters relating to siting and operating a production facility or a utilization facility at or near a covered site to support— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H459F3A143F864C19847687C666D53CDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the reuse of existing site infrastructure, including— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H684F920F3B484000AE57D018868CD29B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) electric switchyard components and transmission infrastructure; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H83DAC1B4A2824D14950EE7D671E31E9C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) heat-sink components; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00DC8E048FE64CA6BA4A58A7D797DD54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) steam cycle components; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67C58C140BDD4347B8F4CCB9268E3870" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) roads; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD6F7F3E5BCF4DA98B16481A85212430" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) railroad access; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13D1C92BA05E44EFB0D25CEBE466DE14" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vi) water availability; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB68066BF880A42F0AC2649EB87FC66F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the use of early site permits; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD001FA3DD88547ECA045546B53758A21" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the utilization of plant parameter envelopes or similar standardized site parameters on a portion of a larger site; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48828D76BED04F9384D753E62881F1AC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the use of a standardized application for similar sites.

COMBINED LICENSE REVIEW PROCEDURE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02B72C6B45FD41C0898F23CDCE9CFCC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general In accordance with this section, the Commission shall establish and carry out an expedited procedure for issuing a combined license pursuant to section 185 b. of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2235(b)).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEBAB72963DD743DA9CA25071074271AE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 207. COMBINED LICENSE REVIEW PROCEDURE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02B72C6B45FD41C0898F23CDCE9CFCC9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general In accordance with this section, the Commission shall establish and carry out an expedited procedure for issuing a combined license pursuant to section 185 b. of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2235(b)).

2235(b)). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2FED78548DBB4A8D9B10F7D247B6B7CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Qualifications To qualify for the expedited procedure under subsection (a), an applicant— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H73FAE28346994EE28B9B320588EB8EA3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) shall submit a combined license application for a new nuclear reactor that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD2248C9C3C7D4780A4A4D01667195054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) references a design for which the Commission has issued a design certification (as defined in section 52.1 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation)); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H882081F954DA4C64A8FBB80AC8F868AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) has a design that is substantially similar to a design of a nuclear reactor for which the Commission has issued a combined license, an operating license, or a manufacturing license under the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.

); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AFBE19D91764303B1AD63CF36162FE1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall propose to construct the new nuclear reactor on a site— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9869C09F54C345F89F2B4C74AA46FE06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) on which a licensed commercial nuclear reactor operates or previously operated; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90FC1D6FA04A41ADA0150C6922BC1C2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) that is directly adjacent to a site on which a licensed commercial nuclear reactor operates or previously operated and has site characteristics that are substantially similar to that site; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H661DA9008D524F2BBCBFE4F0B4D03286" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not be subject to an order of the Commission to suspend or revoke a license under section 2.202 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA35036C075794E4B9E740E500B381AF2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Expedited procedure With respect to a combined license for which the applicant has satisfied the requirements described in subsection (b), the Commission shall, to the maximum extent practicable— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD13F13A950B4C8B843A1DD691079836" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) not later than 18 months after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF128E8EA9C2C46B0825A744B47BBD188" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) complete the technical review process and issue a safety evaluation report; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0DC7BFCF065E4E5B83B28FF89CBAC59F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) issue a final environmental impact statement or environmental assessment, unless the Commission finds that the proposed agency action is excluded pursuant to a categorical exclusion in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.

); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AFBE19D91764303B1AD63CF36162FE1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall propose to construct the new nuclear reactor on a site— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9869C09F54C345F89F2B4C74AA46FE06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) on which a licensed commercial nuclear reactor operates or previously operated; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90FC1D6FA04A41ADA0150C6922BC1C2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) that is directly adjacent to a site on which a licensed commercial nuclear reactor operates or previously operated and has site characteristics that are substantially similar to that site; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H661DA9008D524F2BBCBFE4F0B4D03286" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) may not be subject to an order of the Commission to suspend or revoke a license under section 2.202 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA35036C075794E4B9E740E500B381AF2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Expedited procedure With respect to a combined license for which the applicant has satisfied the requirements described in subsection (b), the Commission shall, to the maximum extent practicable— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD13F13A950B4C8B843A1DD691079836" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) not later than 18 months after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF128E8EA9C2C46B0825A744B47BBD188" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) complete the technical review process and issue a safety evaluation report; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0DC7BFCF065E4E5B83B28FF89CBAC59F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) issue a final environmental impact statement or environmental assessment, unless the Commission finds that the proposed agency action is excluded pursuant to a categorical exclusion in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.

4321 et seq. ); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB5CF2339F0E7479E8698D03204D4C9BD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) not later than 2 years after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing, complete any necessary public licensing hearings and related processes; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D5B2E3CE76840FD92687C1F4880A0AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) not later than 25 months after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing, make a final decision on whether to issue the combined license. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDAB75AAD78B7479DADFF5121BEDC278C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Performance and reporting <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDDE6AF8EBBB24DF2802DA5F6FCA23363" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Delays in issuance Not later than 30 days after the applicable deadline, the Executive Director for Operations of the Commission shall inform the Commission of any failure to meet a deadline under subsection (c).

); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB5CF2339F0E7479E8698D03204D4C9BD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) not later than 2 years after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing, complete any necessary public licensing hearings and related processes; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D5B2E3CE76840FD92687C1F4880A0AD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) not later than 25 months after the date on which the application is accepted for docketing, make a final decision on whether to issue the combined license. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDAB75AAD78B7479DADFF5121BEDC278C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Performance and reporting <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDDE6AF8EBBB24DF2802DA5F6FCA23363" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Delays in issuance Not later than 30 days after the applicable deadline, the Executive Director for Operations of the Commission shall inform the Commission of any failure to meet a deadline under subsection (c). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4FD66E8B7C1D48AEA5E7CE68A75D1E49" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Delays in issuance exceeding 90 days If any deadline under subsection (c) is not met by the date that is 90 days after the applicable date required under that subsection, the Commission shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing the delay, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBCDFA8401C8B4A62BDC21935577C28EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a detailed explanation accounting for the delay; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5FAD65403F64C5FA7CFF0B410020629" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a plan for completion of the applicable action.
